channel.title: Anyone has a Axoloti Core for sale in the EU?
channel.description: Sorry to bother, but I was just a week too late to order an Axoloti Core... and I have no clue whether a new batch will be available. Anyone selling one, and willing to ship to The Netherlands?

item.title: Anyone has a Axoloti Core for sale in the EU?
item.dc:creator: @snellcheeks Jeroen Schellekens
item.description:
@snellcheeks wrote:

Ah right, figuring out this forum a bit, I see it now... sounds promising, I'll wait a bit more, thanks!

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone has a Axoloti Core for sale in the EU?

item.title: Anyone has a Axoloti Core for sale in the EU?
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

You might want to wait a little bit, cause there is a new version of Axoloti in the making, which is a lot more powerful than the original one:

Next-gen and mini Axoloti hardware discussion

@Urklang If you need help with firmware tweaking, keep me tuned.


Call for patches that push Core to its limits, expose issues Patching
As you know I'm working on some next generation hardware as described here: https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/next-gen-and-mini-axoloti-hardware-discussion/5908/216 I want to compile a nice collection of patches that really push the hardware for performance testing. I'm specifically interested in patches that expose issues with SD Card locking or stuttering. Patches that run into memory limitations either SRAM or SDRAM will also be useful. These can be patches that you have from the past or neâ€¦

If you can wait a little bit, I think you should.

Read full topic
